question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckProposalAlreadyVotedBy()] [Duplicate Detection] The Contains() check prevents duplicate voting - but if proposal lists contain duplicate entries before this check, can vote counts be inflated? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckProposalAlreadyVotedBy()] [Race Condition] If vote lists are modified between Contains() checks in OR conditions, can a vote be added to multiple lists simultaneously? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateAddressInWhiteList()] [Null Check] Line 203 accesses State.ProposerWhiteList.Value.Proposers - if ProposerWhiteList.Value is null, does this throw null reference exception allowing whitelist bypass? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateAddressInWhiteList()] [Empty List] If State.ProposerWhiteList.Value.Proposers is empty list, the function returns false - can whitelist be cleared to block all whitelisted proposers? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateAddressInWhiteList()] [Duplicate Entries] If whitelist contains duplicate addresses, does Any() still work correctly or can duplicates cause performance issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateParliamentMemberAuthority()] [Stale Data] Line 208 calls GetCurrentMinerList() - if miner list is cached and not refreshed, can removed miners still pass validation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: ValidateParliamentMemberAuthority()] [Race Condition] If address is removed from miner list between GetCurrentMinerList() call and Any() check, can authorization state be inconsistent? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertCurrentMiner()] [State Dependency] Line 215 calls State.ConsensusContract.IsCurrentMiner(Context.Sender) - if consensus contract is compromised, can it return true for any address? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertCurrentMiner()] [Logging Side Effect] Line 216 logs debug info after getting isCurrentMiner - can this logging be exploited for information disclosure about miner status? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertCurrentMiner()] [Error Message] Line 217 asserts with generic 'No permission' - can this be combined with other functions to bypass specific permission checks? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Collision Attack] Line 222 uses input.Token ?? HashHelper.ComputeFrom(input) - can attacker provide custom Token to create proposal ID collisions with existing proposals? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Predictability] If input.Token is null, HashHelper.ComputeFrom(input) generates deterministic hash - can attacker predict proposal IDs and frontrun proposal creation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Null Token] The function allows null Token (uses ?? operator) - can this create security risks if Context.GenerateId() handles null differently? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Input Validation Order] Line 227 calls CheckCreateProposalInput() before GenerateProposalId() - if validation fails after ID generation, can partially created proposals leak state? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Duplicate Proposal] Line 243 asserts State.Proposals[proposalId] == null - but if proposalId collision occurs (due to GenerateProposalId vulnerability), can existing proposals be blocked from creation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [State Initialization] Lines 229-241 create ProposalInfo with empty Approvals/Rejections/Abstentions lists - are these initialized properly or can null reference exceptions occur in voting functions? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Proposer Assignment] Line 237 sets Proposer = Context.Sender - can this be different from the address checked in AssertIsAuthorizedProposer(), allowing unauthorized proposal creation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Event Timing] Lines 245-251 fire ProposalCreated event after state update - if event handler modifies state, can this cause reentrancy issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Validation Redundancy] Line 242 calls Validate(proposal) after manually creating proposal object - can fields set in lines 229-241 still fail validation due to logic errors? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Length Validation] Line 258 checks Title.Length <= MaxLengthForTitle - can empty titles (length 0) pass validation and create ambiguous proposals? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Length Validation] Line 260 checks Description.Length <= MaxLengthForDescription - can empty descriptions pass validation? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Length Validation] Lines 262-263 check ProposalDescriptionUrl.Length <= MaxLengthForProposalDescriptionUrl - can extremely long URLs cause storage bloat even if under limit? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Null Check Missing] The function checks .Length property but doesn't verify strings are not null first - can null strings cause null reference exception? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Unicode Handling] Length checks use .Length property which counts UTF-16 code units - can Unicode strings with multi-byte characters bypass intended size limits? (Low)
